thread.title_full: 3 interesting things to do this week

author: Mikki Catanzaro Journal Staff
title: 3 interesting things to do this week
text: 3 interesting things to do this week Black families in Gilded Age Newport, Cape Verdean legacy, late night at Newport Art Museum. Comment Posted Oct. 5, 2015 at 12:01 AM By Mikki CatanzaroJournal Staff Posted Oct. 5, 2015 at 12:01 AM The Learning Center at Channing Memorial Church in Newport begins a new semester with historian Theresa Guzman Stokes presenting a two-part walking tour exploring key sites in the city where black families lived, worked, vacationed and worshiped in the 19th century's Gilded Age, Tuesday, Oct. 6 and Oct. 13. For the first tour, participants will gather at 7 p.m. at the church's parish hall at 135 Pelham St. The next meeting location, at 5 p.m., will be decided from there. The fee is $15 for both programs. Enrollment is limited; register by calling the church at (401) 846-0643 or online at office@channingchurch.org. Brown University's Center for the Study of Slavery and Justice presents "Transatlantic Legacy: Full Circle," works by performance and media artist Tony Ramos, a Cape Verdean American from East Providence who lives in the South of France. As part of the series, the public is invited to a screening of "About Media" in Martinos Auditorium of the Granoff Center for the Creative Arts (Ground Floor), 154 Angell St., Providence, Tuesday at 4:30 p.m. After the screening, Ramos will lead a panel discussion. RSVP to cssj_youthprograms@brown.edu . For the full schedule of exhibitions, screenings and panels, go to brown.edu/slaveryjustice . "Art After Dark," a new late-night event at the Newport Art Museum held during Newport Gallery Night, debuts Thursday at 5 p.m. It will extend the museum's hours even further, with it staying open until 10 p.m., and will feature guided tours of the collection, art making opportunities, refreshments and entertainment including live music, demonstrations, performances, films and more. Admission is free; for more information, go to NewportArtMuseum.org/programs-events . By Mikki Catanzaro
